Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support as it is not clear whether all Toys R Us stores are closing and whether gift cards will no longer have value.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all Toys R Us stores are closing and that gift cards will be worthless, without providing concrete evidence.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that as of midday on 14 March 2018, the ToysRUs.com website still accepted gift cards as payment.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the closure of Toys R Us stores and the potential devaluation of gift cards may be related to the retailer's financial situation, rather than a definite fact.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by providing conflicting information and mixed reports about the closure of Toys R Us stores and the value of gift cards.
Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the situation by stating that gift cards are "soon-to-be or no longer have value" without clear evidence to support this.
Understate: None of the biases selected suggest an understatement in the claim.
